snippet: The university’s leaders are contemplating a stronger step to halt an outbreak that has hospitalized seven people: distributing a vaccine not approved for use in the United States.
abstract: Princeton University officials have warned students to stop sharing drinks and to avoid kissing, fearing the spread of a meningitis outbreak that has caused seven people to be hospitalized; officials are considering distributing a vaccine that is not approved for use in the United States, because strain of illness on campus is not covered by the vaccine that is widely used in US.
lead_paragraph: The university’s leaders are contemplating a stronger step to halt an outbreak that has hospitalized seven people: distributing a vaccine not approved for use in the United States.

headline.main: Princeton University Considers Use of Foreign Meningitis Vaccine
headline.print_headline: Princeton Considers Use of Foreign Meningitis Vaccine

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
